commit_message:
Include config-reference documentation for Tintri Cinder driver

Closes-Bug: #1462048

Change-Id: I7372a074f7e287bb2de77618ae5a20511a9badb6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/96/189496/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <section xml:id="tintri-volume-driver" xmlns="http://docbook.org/ns/docbook" xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" version="5.0"> <title>Tintri</title> <para>Tintri VMstore is a smart storage that sees, learns and adapts for cloud and virtualization. Tintri Cinder driver will interact with configured VMstore running Tintri OS 4.0 and above. It supports various operations using Tintri REST APIs and NFS protocol. </para> <para>To configure the use of a Tintri VMstore with Block Storage, modify your <filename>cinder.conf</filename> file as follows:</para> <programlisting language="ini">volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.tintri.TintriDriver # Mount options passed to the nfs client. See section of the # nfs man page for details. (string value) nfs_mount_options=vers=3,lookupcache=none # # Options defined in cinder.volume.drivers.tintri # # The hostname (or IP address) for the storage system (string # value) tintri_server_hostname={Tintri VMstore Management IP} # User name for the storage system (string value) tintri_server_username={username} # Password for the storage system (string value) tintri_server_password={password} # API version for the storage system (string value) #tintri_api_version=v310 # Following options needed for NFS configuration # File with the list of available nfs shares (string value) #nfs_shares_config=/etc/cinder/nfs_shares </programlisting> <para> Following changes are needed in /etc/cinder/nfs_shares </para> <programlisting language="ini"> # Edit /etc/cinder/nfs_shares to add one or more Tintri VMstore mount points # associated with already configured VMstore management IP in cinder.conf {vmstore_data_ip}:/tintri/{submount1} {vmstore_data_ip}:/tintri/{submount2} </programlisting> <para> Following changes are needed in <filename>nova.conf</filename> file as follows:</para> <programlisting language="ini"> # Edit /etc/nova/nova.conf nfs_mount_options=vers=3 </programlisting> <xi:include href="../../../common/tables/cinder-tintri.xml"/> </section>

commit_message:
Adds Hyper-V imagecache cleanup

At the moment the Hyper-V driver's imagecache only deals with caching
the images in _base.

This blueprint will deal with implementing imagecache management that will
allow the aging and deletion of cached images that are no longer in use.

This is a driver feature parity blueprint.

Implements: blueprint hyper-v-imagecache-cleanup

Change-Id: I9d787095e91c2366683d060c0eaf21aeedf58fbb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/25/190625/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Hyper-V imagecache cleanup ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/hyper-v-imagecache-cleanup At the moment the Hyper-V driver's imagecache only deals with caching the images in _base. Problem description =================== This blueprint will deal with implementing imagecache management that will allow the aging and deletion of cached images that are no longer in use. This is a driver feature parity blueprint. Use Cases ---------- Project Priority ----------------- None Proposed change =============== The imagecache manager will check all the images that are currently used by a node and delete the ones that are old enough. Resized vhd files and the original image will be treated like a block, meaning if a image is eligible for deletion it will be deleted along with all the resized ones. Implementation is straight forward and consists of extending the ImageCacheManager class and implementing a driver specific method of aging and deleting the images. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ Since images that are not used anymore are deleted it will reduce the amount of space necessary to store images. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Adelina Tuvenie <atuvenie@cloudbasesolutions.com> Work Items ---------- Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit tests Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

subject: Fix config option fallback if "include" missing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-11 16:05:59.000000000', 'files': ['bandit/core/manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/bandit/commit/fe0bc8977d74c1857732c859354f2cf0166e4fd9', 'message': 'Fix config option fallback if "include" missing

Currently, if an "include" stanza is missing from the config
file and recursive checking is requested, a nasty error is
experienced.

When the included config option is used, it is supposed to
sanely fall back to the default of "*.py", but rather than
being set as a list (as is expected) a coding error sets it
to be a string.

This change resolves this issue by returning a list of one
item ['*.py'], rather than a string.

Change-Id: Ieb631032d1cc2d6e1864ca3d26b2155219fbd13e
Closes-bug: #1434281
Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <email@daviey.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix config option fallback if "include" missing

Currently, if an "include" stanza is missing from the config
file and recursive checking is requested, a nasty error is
experienced.

When the included config option is used, it is supposed to
sanely fall back to the default of "*.py", but rather than
being set as a list (as is expected) a coding error sets it
to be a string.

This change resolves this issue by returning a list of one
item ['*.py'], rather than a string.

Change-Id: Ieb631032d1cc2d6e1864ca3d26b2155219fbd13e
Closes-bug: #1434281
Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <email@daviey.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bandit refs/changes/04/190704/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Lieutenants, officially setup Neutron PTL Office Hours.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/38/189338/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Neutron Stadium =============== Starting with the Kilo release of OpenStack, the project is now using new governance rules which have been termed ["The Big Tent."][1]. The "tl;dr" version of this new governance is that the project is much more accepting of new projects being added into the OpenStack namespace. At a micro level, the "Neutron Stadium" is a similar concept: We're now accepting more projects into the Neutron namespace. These include the following: * Plugin backends, both for open source as well as vendor plugins. * API additions which are not part of core neutron. * Service plugins for routing and advanced services. The following is a list of places [1]: http://superuser.openstack.org/articles/openstack-as-layers-but-also-a-big-tent-but-also-a-bunch-of-cats

Add manila client to heat requirements

The requirements for manila client has been added (the version is
the same as global-requirements version). Also the manilaclient version
is introduced when creating a client.

commit_message:
Add error catching to the cleanup method for Heat tests

If the test fails on some step it calls cleanup method that tries
to delete the created stack, but in case if there is some problem
in it user won't see errors in FUEL web, that's why error catching
was added.

Closes-Bug: #1463339

Change-Id: I93b72d24e54dde31c9dd608c98be857aa9a65657

added_lines: try: self.heat_client.stacks.delete(stack.id) except: self.fail("Cleanup: Failed to delete stack '%s'" % stack_name)
